org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbcapi

Class BLOBTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbcapi.BLOBTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public final class BLOBTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Tests reading and updating binary large objects (BLOBs).

      • testBlobCastInValuesClause

        public void testBlobCastInValuesClause()
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       java.sql.SQLException
        Tests that a stream value in a values clause can be cast to a BLOB.

        See DERBY-4102 (test case resulted in a ClassCastException earlier).

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong

      • testDerby4477_3645_3646_Repro

        public void testDerby4477_3645_3646_Repro()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                          java.io.IOException
        Tests that a lob can be safely occur multiple times in a SQL select.

        See DERBY-4477.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        BlobMemTest.testDerby4477_3645_3646_Repro_lowmem(), ClobMemTest.testDerby4477_3645_3646_Repro_lowmem_clob()

      • testDerby4477_2349_Repro

        public void testDerby4477_2349_Repro()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Tests that a lob can be safely occur multiple times in a SQL select in a trigger context.

        See DERBY-4477.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • testDerby2992_Repro

        public void testDerby2992_Repro()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.sql.SQLException
        Checks that Derby fails with an exception when a transaction using READ_UNCOMMITTED obtains a stream from a BLOB (reads one byte) and at the same time another connection deletes the BLOB.

        Earlier only parts of the BLOB was returned, without errors. It was impossible to tell for the user that only parts of the value was retrieved.

        See DERBY-2992.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testDerby1511

        public void testDerby1511()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Regression test case for DERBY-1511. Scans of tables with large objects used to fail if commits were issued during the scans.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • verifyNewValueInTable

        private void verifyNewValueInTable(int newVal,
                                   int newSize)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.sql.SQLException
        Verifies that the table has row with column val=newVal and that it its data and size columns are consistent.
        Parameters:
        newVal - value expected to be found in the val column of a row
        newSize - expected size of size column and size of blob
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - causes test to fail with error
        java.io.IOException - causes test to fail with error

      • verifyBlob

        private void verifyBlob(int expectedVal,
                        int expectedSize,
                        java.sql.Blob blob)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        Verifies that the blob is consistent
        Parameters:
        expectedVal - the InputStream for the Blob should return this value for every byte
        expectedSize - the BLOB should have this size
        blob - the BLOB to check
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - causes test to fail with error
        java.io.IOException - causes test to fail with error
